alert.note: Alert for Fisher; Nolan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 9:52PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN NOLAN AND SOUTHERN FISHER COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 PM CDT... At 948 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms in western Nolan and Fisher Counties, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Sweetwater, Roscoe, Roby, Sylvester, Interstate 20, Wastella, Longworth, Champion, Us-180 in Fisher County, Lake Sweetwater, Busby, Capitola, Highway 70 from Roby to south of Sweetwater, and Camp Boothe Oaks. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 229 and 260. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
